newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: AUSTRALIA YIELD SPREADS-WOBBLE VS BLOC BAR N.Z..
newsitem.headline: AUSTRALIA YIELD SPREADS-WOBBLE VS BLOC BAR N.Z..

text.p: Australian bonds ended little changed against its North American counterparts within the dollar bloc after see-sawing either side of Wednesday's levels.

Yield differentials tightened initially in anticipation of a weak outcome to the July labour force report, and although the overall employment outcome was much in line with expectations at a rise of 21,300, the market wobbled slightly on a 52,500 in full-time employment.
However, this jump in what is seen as an extremely volatile section of the series was quickly diminished, leaving thoughts of a further monetary policy easing as a vague possibility.
While spread movements to the U.S. and Canada fluctuated, differentials to New Zealand generally went in only one direction with the negative spread widening again.
The N.Z. market was under pressure from the opening as the N.Z. dollar slipped again only later to be depressed by a poor reception to a NZ$150 million bond tender.
